Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
What will the program cost?

There are no student fees during the Academic Start. There will be small fees associated with applications and standardized tests during the Professional Certificate and Degree Seeking program.

Application Fee No Cost
Registration Deposit No Cost
Yearly Matriculation Fee No Cost
Ghana Tuition Fee (per credit hour)* $20
Mexico Tuition Fee (per credit hour)* $35
Peru Tuition Fee (per credit hour)* $30
Institute of Religion Tuition Fee No Cost
Example: a 5-credit class in Ghana would cost $100 ($20 x 5); the same class in Mexico would cost $175 ($35 x 5)

Tuition Information

  • Payment for tuition is always due 10 days before class begins.
  • If you register late, tuition is due upon registration.
  • A late charge of 5% of the unpaid balance will be assessed for any late payments seven days following the the first day of the semester. A service charge of 1% per month will be charged each month for any unpaid balance.
  • The only way to get a full refund is if you withdraw from your course within the first seven days of the semester. If you withdraw after the first seven days you will receive a prorated refund.
  • If you withdraw after the first seven days of the semester and have not yet paid your tuition you will still owe a prorated amount.

*Tuition for the Pathway Program may increase annually at the same rate as that for other students; nonetheless, these changes, if any, would be minimal.

Can I get financial assistance?

The significantly reduced Pathway International fees can be seen as a form of financial assistance/grants for the students. At this stage the University does not provide other direct financial assistance; however, PEF loans may be available in your country--please check with your Pathway Mission Couple for more information.

Where do I begin?

Visit with your local mission couple or institute director to start the application process.
